description: The former pub near Northallerton closed in 2018 with the owners blaming a lack of trade.
title: North Yorkshire village pub to be turned into house
title_page: North Yorkshire village pub to be turned into house - BBC News
maintext:
A former pub in a North Yorkshire village is set to be turned into a house if plans are approved.
The proposals would see the Shorthorn Inn in Appleton Wiske, near Northallerton, converted into a five-bedroom home.
The pub closed in 2018, with the owners blaming a slowing of trade.
The building is currently up for sale with a guide price of Â£650,000.
